title: Energy conservation - skydiver at constant speed

content.question: A skydiver with an open parachute falls toward the ground at a constant speed. Is the mechanical energy of the skydiver-Earth system constant as the skydiver descends? Why or why not?

choices.label: Yes, because the kinetic energy of the skydiver remains constant.
Yes, because the net force on the skydiver-Earth system is zero.
No, because the potential energy of the system decreases, and the kinetic energy of the skydiver remains constant.
No, because the kinetic energy of the skydiver increases, and the potential energy of the system remains constant.

content.answer: No, because the potential energy of the system decreases, and the kinetic energy of the skydiver remains constant.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
